Data: Behardien to Watson, no run Watson reaches out and drives, but extra cover cuts it off with a sprint to his right

Behardien to Watson, OUT well, well, the part-timer has taken out Shane Watson, and he is not reviewing, Behardien angles it in on a length, it moves in late a bit too, Watson's bat has to come around that big front foot, it cannot do so quickly enough, and he is given straight away, tracker says that is hitting middle and leg near the top
Behardien to Bailey, no run eases forward to a length ball and pushes to covers
Behardien to Bailey, 1 run they go to the third umpire for a direct hit, but Smith is home after Bailey nudged in front of midwicket
Behardien to Smith, 1 wide sprayed quite far outside off
Behardien to Smith, no run bowled full for the drive, Smith pings extra cover with the shot
Behardien to Smith, FOUR runs length ball into the pad and Smith moves across to nudge it past the keeper
Morkel to Bailey, no run goes back in the crease to one rising from good length, and pats it away
Morkel to Bailey, 1 leg bye this climbs in to him, he walks across, and fends it off one hand down to fine leg

Morkel to Smith, OUT that is probably not the best stroke to play at this stage, Morkel bangs it in short of a length, Smith tries to force a pull, and Tahir takes the steepling top edge after moving to his left from mid on, mid off was around too, but Tahir hung on in the end, wasn't really the length for the pull
Morkel to Marsh, no run back of a length, nudged to square leg

Behardien to Marsh, no run short of a length, guided to point

Behardien to Bailey, 3 runs could have played on there, pushed forward to this length ball and inside edged it past the stumps, Morkel goes sprawling at fine leg, palms it in, it brushes his leg, but he's touched the rope after that
Behardien to Marsh, 1 leg bye moving into the pad again, and worked behind square
Behardien to Bailey, no run leans forward and taps it to mid on
Behardien to Bailey, FOUR runs this hangs in the air for a while as it comes slow and full outside off, he waits and ensure he hits the drive between short extra cover and mid off

Morkel to Marsh, 2 runs almost another one, he spooned that drive in the air as he didn't really get forward to a full one, de Villiers ran to his right and dived full length but it still landed short, he then got up and hared after it, superman AB
Morkel to Marsh, no run beaten now as he prods at a lifter outside off

Morkel to Wade, no run walks outside off to a length ball slanted across, and lets it go, it thuds into the keeper's gloves

Morkel to Wade, OUT Keeper and bowler are convinced about the caught behind, umpire isnt, de Kock is pushing for the review immediately, and South Africa are doing that, Wade on the hop to a short of a length ball into the ribcage, it has brushed his shirt, third umpire says that is close to the glove, and wants to look at HotSpot, there is
Morkel to Maxwell, no run gathers himself to defend a back of a length ball

Morkel to Maxwell, OUT it is coming apart for Australia, as Morkel removes Maxwell for a duck, he was on his toes trying to run this short of a length ball towards third man, ends up playing on, again, you have to say that is not a good choice of stroke off your second ball

Steyn to Coulter-Nile, no run beauty from Steyn, just held the line on a good length on off stump to zip past the edge, he wasn't exactly playing forward to it too

Steyn to Coulter-Nile, OUT nine down, Faf in business at mid on again, a length ball around middle and off, Coulter-Nile whips it for a tumbling Faf to take his second catch, not easy to pull off these shots with the pace and bounce in the pitch

Philander to Bailey, OUT Philander strikes immediately on comeback, and that is a fine catch by Faf, another one falls to the pull, Bailey wasn't on top of the stroke as he hit it off the front foot low to Faf at mid on, and he went down to pouch it

Steyn to Marsh, SIX runs he's flat batted Steyn over the long off boundary, back of a length ball, he wallops it off the front foot
Steyn to Marsh, 1 wide Steyn slips it full down the leg side now

Steyn to Marsh, OUT it is hard to clear Morne Morkel wherever he is, he is at short fine leg, this is a slower one into the pad, and Marsh has flicked it for Morkel to take it over his head
We will be back around 3.10 pm, er, whenever the chase begins, that is

Five wickets and two catches for Morne Morkel, who has demolished Australia for 154 on a fast and bouncy WACA pitch. From the moment he had Warner hopping in his first over, Morkel has been difficult to play. South Africa were a bowler short, but Behardien took out Watson and bowled eight decent overs. Morkel returned to crush Australia with three
3.35pm Out come Hashim Amla and Quinton de Kock to chase 155. And here's Mitchell Johnson with two regular slips and a fly slip

Johnson to de Kock, 1 wide shorter this time and flying high, too high, say the umpires
Johnson to de Kock, no run back of a length, pushed to covers
Johnson to de Kock, FOUR runs overpitched on off, and de Kock extends his arms to drive it nicely in the big gap at extra cover
Johnson to de Kock, no run moving away a tad from just back of a length, de Kock shuffles across and lets it be
Johnson to de Kock, no run more movement away from the left hander, who shoulders arms
Johnson to de Kock, no run back of a length, tapped to covers

Johnson to Amla, no run
Johnson to Amla, 1 wide Amla moves across, Johnson goes full and too wide

Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run back of a length delivery worked to midwicket
Hazlewood to Rossouw, 1 run edged between the slips and gully to third man, but he was playing that length ball softly and it ran along the ground

Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, 1 run swivels and pulls comfortably to deep midwicket

Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, FOUR runs is bounced around off, and swings hard at the pull, it is in the air through vacant midwicket and wide of the fielder in the deep
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run that came in and wasn't far from off stump but AB has left it so casually as if it was a wide
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run opens the face and guides it to point
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 2 runs hops and nudges an angled back of a length ball to midwicket, and there is an overthrow too
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run left alone outside off to bring on drinks

Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run full and spinning in to the pad, worked square
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run played with the spin to deep midwicket
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run goes back to punch as this offbreak hurries in
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run leaves the crease as Maxwell tosses it up, Faf nudges to midwicket
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run turned to square leg with the spin
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, FOUR runs that has been dismissed to the deep extra cover boundary, a stride forward and a clean, confident drive with a slightly open face to hit the gap
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, FOUR runs takes a step across, flows into the line of this length ball and dispatches it between extra cover and mid off now
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run worked behind square leg
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run opens the face to defend a good length ball to point
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run appears to go hard but checks his push to mid on in the end
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, FOUR runs this time he will beat mid on easily to his left, full again and he's driven it hard down the ground
Maxwell to de Villiers, no run pushes an offbreak to covers
Maxwell to de Villiers, 2 runs this is cut high in the air but over and wide of short third man
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 wide bounces and spins down the leg side
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run went straight on outside off, AB chops the cut and it runs past the keeper
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run has a go at the cut but is beaten
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run punched off the back foot to extra cover
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run cuts again, but cover runs to his right to stop it
Johnson to de Villiers, no run pushes a length ball softly to cover
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR runs whoa, Johnson has been smeared dead straight down the ground, this is a length ball slanted across, he has closed the face and just smacked it
Johnson to de Villiers, no run
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR runs he's walked across to off now, this has arrived short, and he's got on top of it to shovel it down to the fine leg boundary
Johnson to de Villiers, no run
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR runs take that, one more, Johnson slants it wide, and AB crashes it between extra cover and mid off
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run back of a length, cramping him for room, he pats it back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Miller, no run length ball slanted across, but he is able to defend with a slightly closed face
Hazlewood to Miller, no run rises with this short of a length ball and chops it into the crease
Hazlewood to Miller, no run leans into a length ball and pushes it down the track, they think about a single, but mid on cuts it off
Johnson to de Villiers, no run AB tries to play an awkward attacking forehand type slap to this short of a length ball leaving him on the angle, and is beaten
Johnson to de Villiers, 2 runs inside edge in front of square leg now, they rush back for the second and a dive is needed, all happening suddenly
Johnson to de Villiers, no run AB hit on the chest now as he under edges an attempted pull
Johnson to de Villiers, no run the timing has gone too suddenly, as AB gets too far across and chops it into the ground
Johnson to de Villiers, no run hits the pad and pops up in the air, he fell too far across trying to work a length ball to leg
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 leg bye Johnson bangs it in and AB he is made to hop and fend this one handed down the leg side
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run moves in from short of a length and is left alone close to off
Hazlewood to de Villiers, FOUR runs AB edges the hook to a bouncer headed down leg, but it has gone well clear of a diving Wade
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run moves across outside off and turns the wrists to play it softly towards point
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run pitched up and pushed neatly to mid on
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run back of a length, outside off, he walks across and lifts bat high
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 2 runs he takes this high bouncer and drags it into the ground through midwicket
Johnson to Miller, 1 run back of a length, angled in, awkwardly jabbed to square leg from close to the splice
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run gets on top of the bouncer and smacks a pull to deep square leg
Johnson to Miller, 2 runs moves forward to push a length delivery through the covers
Johnson to Miller, no run 141 kph and climbs into Miller, who rides the bounce and brings it down safely
Johnson to Miller, 1 wide Johnson pings in a bouncer, Miller lets it pass over
Johnson to Miller, no run nearly 142 kph, angled and rising into the body, he moves across and jabs it down, taking a hand off the bat
Johnson to Miller, 1 run length ball clipped with the angle in front of square leg
Hazlewood to Miller, no run Miller is beaten, Hazlewood starts it across on an angle and it moves further away after pitching as Miller pushes forward
Hazlewood to Miller, no run brings down a short ball but square leg is around to keep him on strike
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run edged, but falling short of gully diving to his right as Miller pushes at this length ball
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run eases a pitched up ball down the track on the off side
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run checks his pull off the front foot to square leg
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run short of a length, tapped to the cordon
Johnson to Miller, no run short of a length ball worked nicely off the pad but a quite short fine leg stops it
Johnson to Miller, no run they are attacking him with angled bouncers, Millers keeps another one down on the pitch, off the glove
Johnson to Miller, no run not as short this time, he leans across and pushes it down the pitch
Johnson to Miller, 5 wide Johnson digs in the bouncer too short with plenty of effort, and it flies over Wade's who only gets some glove on it as he jumps
Johnson to Miller, no run leans forward to defend a good length ball
Johnson to Miller, no run a slower bouncer too now, at 117.6 kph, Miller swings and misses
Johnson to Miller, 1 wide another bouncer, Miller sways inside the line, it is called a no-ball as Johnson has bowled one too many for the over
Johnson to Miller, FOUR runs he pitches it up last ball of the over, but Miller is up to it, he leans forward and dispatches it through vacant mid off
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run back of a length, left alone outside off
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run shortish and down the pads, AB swings it down to fine leg
Hazlewood to Miller, no run slanted across on a good length, left alone
Hazlewood to Miller, no run back of a length, moves away after pitching, and leaves Miller feeling for it off the back foot
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run pulls to the right of Johnson at fine leg
Coulter-Nile to Miller, FOUR runs Miller almost settles the issue as he leans into another drive, closing the face to a pitched up delivery around off to drive it past the non-striker
Coulter-Nile to Miller, 2 runs turned off the pad behind square for two more
Coulter-Nile to Miller, no run rides the bounc on this back of a length ball to drop it into the pitch
Coulter-Nile to Miller, 2 runs swivels and pulls hard, but he's not middled it, and it has not gone far from midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Miller, FOUR runs four more for Miller, Coulter-Nile overpitches, and Miller eases it between extra cover and mid off
Coulter-Nile to Miller, no run pings short extra cover as he middles another full delivery
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run angled in good length to Steyn, who pushes it away safely
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run backs away, swishes and misses, Wade goes up for caught behind in hope
Hazlewood to Steyn, FOUR runs Steyn does it by clearing front leg and whacking this length delivery over the bowler

Australia fighting till the end but they just didn't have the runs. Rossouw calmed the early nerves with a polished 30, AB took over and twinkled his way to 48 off 41, and Miller kept his nerve in the end with an unbeaten 22. The series is tied 1-1 going into the third game in Canberra
That is all from this game. Good bye
South Africa won by 3 wickets (with 134 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Morne Morkel, SA
